name: Causal Truth Axiom
intent: Define truth as stable, consequence-bearing representations under Π-induced dynamics.
constraints: There exists an induced outcome dynamics G: O \-\> O derived from H \= Π ∘ Φ ∘ δ or a related construction.
A representation r ∈ R is causally true iff Π(r) is an attracting fixed point of G (lim\_{n→∞} G^n(Π(r)) \= Π(r)).
Causal truth must be stable under small perturbations of r consistent with Φ-stability.
